name: NetBIOS Name Service Spoofer
author: Tim Medin <tim@securitywhole.com>
description:
This module forges NetBIOS Name Service (NBNS) responses. It will listen for NBNS requests
          sent to the local subnet's broadcast address and spoof a response, redirecting the querying
          machine to an IP of the attacker's choosing. Combined with auxiliary/server/capture/smb or
          auxiliary/server/capture/http_ntlm it is a highly effective means of collecting crackable hashes on
          common networks.

          This module must be run as root and will bind to udp/137 on all interfaces.

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: TIMEOUT
options.description: The number of seconds to wait for new data

options.name: GATEWAY_PROBE_HOST
options.description: Send a TTL=1 random UDP datagram to this host to discover the default gateway's MAC

options.name: GATEWAY_PROBE_PORT
options.description: The port on GATEWAY_PROBE_HOST to send a random UDP probe to (random if 0 or unset)

options.name: SPOOFIP
options.description: IP address with which to poison responses

options.name: REGEX
options.description: Regex applied to the NB Name to determine if spoofed reply is sent
